item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)

tei:ab.tei:supplied: ʾĪlsharaḥ and his son, of the lineage of Yaḥmān, the Ṣirwāḥites, have paid over
to, and bestowed upon, ʾĪlmu-
quh, Lord of the Ibexes, all of the total amount of income and the profit of the
valid document, namely the document which ʾĪlmuquhū had demanded of the lineage of Ya-
ḥmān, the document which Ḥaywān of the lineage of Yaḥmān, the Ṣirwāḥī, had authenticated,
the document which prescribes taxes forever from Ẓabiyyān to
ʾĪlmuquh. Now this very grant is written proof for the lineage of Ya-
ḥmān of that document, if ever it i.e. the document is contested, and let it then be pub-
licized. And this written proof was drawn up in the month of Dhū-Nasūr,
the initial part of the eponymous year of Yiqahmalik bin ʾAbī-
ʿamm of Kabīr-Khalīl.
